artist: Designer: Frank E. Burley; Manufacturer: Copeland Factory
creditline: Gift of Marjorie Glessner Broady, in memory of her mother, Florence Irene Valentine
description: round body with short foot; clear glaze at interior and on handle; applied decoration in white on blue burning buildings at neck; 3 ovals on sides with pioneer man with ax, gun and covered wagon, female personification with eagle on her head, holding a right angle and a shield, and 2 Native Americans with teepees; small scenes on sides 4 horses drawing a carriage in front of a large building, men exiting a boat with 2 seated Native Americans, firefighter, house with fence and trees, Mrs. O'Leary with her cow kicking over the lantern, a fort, 2 Native Americans threatening a woman, and a priest with a cross in a boat approaching 2 Native Americans
markings: \'[crown]/CHICAGO PITCHER/DESIGNED/BY/FRANK, E, BURLEY/EDITION DE LUXE./BURLEY & CÂº/CHICAGO [inside a cartouche]\', \'No 467\' and \'COPELAND/LATE/SPODE/ENGLAND\', stamped in brown, on bottom; \'ENGLAND [?-illegible]/COPELAND\', stamped, on bottom over crown
title: Chicago pitcher
